title: Double-slit - pattern of photon and electron beams

content.question: A beam of photons and a beam of electrons are each sent through identical pairs of narrow, closely-spaced slits. The photons’ wavelength and the electrons’ wavelength are the same and comparable to the width of the slits. Which of the following correctly describes the patterns produced by the two beams on a screen located some distance beyond the slits?

choices.label: The photons produce a pattern in the shape of the slits, while the electrons produce a pattern of interference fringes.
The photons produce a pattern of interference fringes, while the electrons produce a pattern in the shape of the slits.
Both the photons and the electrons produce a pattern in the shape of the slits.
Both the photons and the electrons produce a pattern of interference fringes.

content.answer: Both the photons and the electrons produce a pattern of interference fringes.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
